cards.title: Define v0 target: mushroom species
cards.description: Pick first species to optimise for (e.g., oyster vs lion‚Äôs mane vs shiitake). Drives temperature, RH, fresh-air exchange, and recipe design.

cards.title: Define v0 target: greens format
cards.description: Decide microgreens trays vs baby-leaf, tray size, and whether soil/coco/hydro. Drives irrigation and lighting needs.

cards.title: Decide product architecture: one chamber vs two variants
cards.description: Single chamber supports both via recipes vs two variants / swappable inserts. Capture rationale in decision map.

cards.title: Choose isolation tier (CEA control level)
cards.description: Tier 1 stabilised enclosure vs Tier 2 managed intake/exhaust vs Tier 3 near-sealed. Home market likely Tier 1‚Äì2.

cards.title: Set target price band for v0
cards.description: Pick rough band (¬£100 / ¬£500 / ¬£1500). Constrains BOM, complexity, and what ‚Äòautopilot‚Äô means.

cards.title: Define MVP sensor/actuator stack (non-vendor)
cards.description: Minimum viable: temp+RH, door sensor; actuators: fan (FAE), humidifier; add lights + watering for greens; optional CO‚ÇÇ.

cards.title: Design the recipe data model (stages + ranges + schedules)
cards.description: Recipe = stages (incubation/fruiting etc) with setpoint ranges, schedules, safety limits, and versioning; manual stage switch at first.

cards.title: Prototype 0: logging + dashboard
cards.description: Instrument sensors and log time series + actuator states + user events. Goal: learn dynamics and failure modes before full automation.

cards.title: Prototype 1: humidity control loop
cards.description: Implement simple hysteresis (then PID if needed) for RH. Add safeguards against over-wetting and condensation.

cards.title: Prototype 1: fresh-air exchange (FAE) scheduling
cards.description: Fan cycles to manage CO‚ÇÇ/morphology while avoiding drying. Consider adding optional CO‚ÇÇ sensor later.

cards.title: Greens: lighting schedule + dimming strategy
cards.description: Define photoperiod and intensity control approach; decide if light sensor is needed in v0.

cards.title: Greens: watering approach
cards.description: Decide bottom watering vs misting vs drip; add root-zone moisture sensing if needed; manage damping-off risk.

cards.title: Define contamination / cleanability principles
cards.description: Mushrooms need contamination control; define how users clean, replace filters, manage standing water, and handle fruiting blocks.

cards.title: Brand: choose canonical name form (Grow Cabin vs GrowCabin)
cards.description: Decide two-words vs one-word for packaging/handles; draft tagline and visual direction.

cards.title: Write the one-page project brief
cards.description: Distill: who it‚Äôs for, problem, value proposition, MVP, constraints, and next milestone.

cards.title: Research pack: 10‚Äì20 high-quality CEA sources
cards.description: Standards + FAO/universities + review papers + practical vendor docs; attach to taxonomy/case studies with citations.

cards.title: Created Grow Cabin project file with decision trees
Drafted smart farming taxonomy + glossary + case-study scaffold
Spun up Grow Cabin project board
cards.description: Board files in agent-dashboard-web/store/grow-cabin-board/ (Kanban + Decisions + Brain + Rules)
